column1: JINYA Ramen Bar - Houston////Our pork chashu
column2: which is made from pork belly
column3: is by design a boneless cut of fatty meat. One recommendation is to swap out the pork chashu for chicken chashu
column7: as they are listed on the menu, are flash boiled, set in an ice bath for several hours, peeled, an then marinated for 48 hours. Another suggestion is to request a hard-boiled egg, or a non-marinated egg. It may take extra time, but we will always accommodate a customers' request if it is within our power to do so.
